Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/ad: I wish I had time to make more show pieces, but Adeline keeps me so busy making nails and joints...
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/ba: Balor buys a lot of replacement parts for his wagon from me and Ryis... what's he get up to, I wonder? And where does he get all that rare ore?
Baron Wiscar really knew his stuff, he could have been a blacksmith if he hadn't been granted peerage by the king.
The bath feels amazing after a day spent hammering away at the forge. Whew.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/be: W-what? I didn't say I was going to try it!
You know, sand can be turned to glass at extremely high temperatures...
I know you can't help staring, but can you do it from further away?
Ryis and I are having a shell-collecting competition. It's friendly.
Making yourself at home, I see.
Hemlock's an excellent bartender. I haven't had better =Beer=, even in the Capital.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/bi: What is it? I've got a big work order to get through.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/ca: I've got half a mind to skip dinner and put some time in at the forge... but Olric says dinner is our sacred bro time.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/ch: Blacksmithing is hard work, but it does burn through a lot of energy. A bar of =Chocolate= is a good boost.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/co: Let Hemlock pick a brew for you. He always gets it right.
A cold =Beer= hits different after a long day of work.
Nothing better than a cold drink after working on a hot summer's day.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/ei: Sometimes Eiland asks me to make replicas of old artifacts... I thought it was boring at first, but the ancients actually have a lot to teach about working metal.
One of the greats, learning from the greats... that's me!
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/er: Just taking care of a few things around town.
I keep having to remind him that other folks need eggs too.
Olric asked me to pick up five dozen $Eggs$ while I was at the store...
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/fa: Must be nice, working in something as forgiving as farming. You can't play around when you're working with molten metal.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/fi: It'll be hard to keep up on my work if it stays this cold.
It was a battle to get the fire going earlier.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/fn: Not now, [Ari]. Concentrating. I have to get this done if I want to make it to the Inn later.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/fo: I'm all fired up! Let's make some nails!
There's nothing better than working the forge in fall. Taste that crisp air!
I like working the forge in autumn. The chill in the air makes it pretty cozy.
Hard to keep the forge fire going on rainy days...
You'll get burned if you're careless.
Hey, watch yourself around the forge.
There's no escaping this heat when there's work to be done.
Whew...
At breathing down my neck when I'm working?
Hmm, is it just me or are you getting more skilled-
But you better clean up after yourself.
I'll let you use the forge if you need it...
Don't stand too close... I'm trying to work here.
The contrast is nice.
It's warm by the forge on a cold day.
You can warm up by the forge, if you want.
Aren't you cold, standing around like that?
It's best to get forge work in early, before the day's heat sets in.
The temperature inside the forge has been steady today.
So don't distract me.
Keeping the heat even requires a lot of concentration.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/ge: A book on how to deal with difficult people.
I'm not trying to be funny! Get out!
Do you uh, normally come into people's rooms uninvited? Is that a thing where you're from?
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/go: Time for bed. That's your cue to leave.
Take notes, [Ari]...my swing is poetry in motion.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/gr: The name's March... What do you want?
I'm [Ari], the new farmer in town!
I don't see what that has to do with me. Regardless of what Adeline says, we really don't need an outsider to come in and solve our problems for us.
You must be this "farmer" folks are talking about. Regardless of what Adeline says, we don't need an outsider to come in and solve our problems for us.
I- We have everything under control. Just don't get in the way.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/ha: It might be time to upgrade my hammer... don't get too excited, [Ari]. I don't do hand-me-downs.
He's probably eating a $Hard Boiled Egg$ right now.
If it wasn't for me, Olric wouldn't eat any vegetables. He'd have $Hard Boiled Eggs$ for every meal!
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/he: Why are you looking at me like that...?
What do you want? Make it quick.
And I don't know what Adeline was thinking, giving it away to some stranger.
I don't know what you're hoping to gain by taking over that farm.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/im: This is a big, important order. So unless this is a big, important conversation...
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/in: I'm really... what is it Olric's always saying?
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/kn: Maybe I can make some kind of sharpener people can use at home...
I didn't realize there'd be such a demand for knife sharpening.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/la: Landen brags a lot, but he really knows his stuff.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/le: Are you going to take a bath? Fine, I was leaving anyway.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/lo: I know I make it look easy, but that's from long practice.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/lu: We're lucky to have Balor here, his prices are fairer than other merchants that have come through Mistria.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/me: An order for anything but nails makes my day.
Valen asked me to make medical instruments.
Balor said his wagon took some, uh, battle damage. What is he doing with it, anyway? Off-roading?
A messy forge can be dangerous, so I take cleaning seriously.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/mi: When the mine was open, I never had to worry about supplies. I've had to learn how to do a lot with a little.
At least I can still look forward to the inn placing orders for new knives.
I miss making swords. It's just too big of a material waste.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/mo: Oh, is it raining? I barely noticed.
We get most of our meals at the Inn these days. Olric trying to fry eggs on the forge was stressing me out...
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/ne: Whew, I need a break. Can't rush perfection.
You need something? Otherwise I'm working.
This new piece is going to turn heads. I'm hoping Balor takes an interest and finds a buyer in the Capital.
Josephine asked me to make new silverware for the Inn, and she kept it simple, but... I've got ideas...
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/ol: Olric always asks me to work out with him, but working at the forge is enough for me.
I heard Olric is at the woodshop... is he getting into trouble with the old-timers again?
If you want to thank Olric for always being so nice to you, he always appreciates a nice piece of $Stone$. He likes to collect them.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/pl: I've got places to be, [Ari]. I bet you do too, so let's keep it moving.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/pr: We've had a problem getting enough ore ever since the Earthquake shut down the Mines.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/ra: As much as I enjoy it when you stop to talk, do you have to do it in the rain?
The forge gets nice and cool on rainy days.
Olric says there's plenty to do indoors on a rainy day, but it's not forgework.
Can't let a little rain slow me down.
I keep the forge hot, even on rainy days.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/re: You need our gear? Makes sense.
Oh, it's you. Well if you need something...
You can just leave your money by the till, you know.
These kinds of repairs are the easiest... and the most boring.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/ru: Don't you have work to do?
How is it that I always see you running around town?
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/ry: When Ryis arrived to town he actually made things better for everyone... Something for you to think about.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/sh: I ship my work out all over the country, you know. Balor's great at finding folks who appreciate my work.
Let me know if you see any shoddy metalwork around town. I like to keep things in top shape.
Let me know if you actually want to buy something.
Let me guess, here to ogle the merchandise?
I don't really mind if you're here to study my work.
Are you working on your blacksmithing skill?
Everything in here was handmade by me, you won't find better quality anywhere in Aldaria.
I didn't become a blacksmith to be a shopkeep. Don't try to haggle.
You wouldn't think it, but Olric's handwriting is pretty good. This shopping list is really clear.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/si: Oh, it's [Ari]. Don't you have some dirt to shovel?
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/sn: The forge is the perfect place to be on a snowy day.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/so: Different metals require different temperatures, different blacksmithing techniques. I'm always learning something new.
Not now, [Ari], I have somewhere to be.
Ryis was right, they sound great. Glad I came out to see it.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/ta: I'm sure you can fix your own by now, right?
I'm taking orders for tool repairs around town today.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/te: In either case, failure can lead to disaster.
Tempering is an art, whether you're making swords or nails.
I'm finishing up a batch of custom hooks for Terithia... or I would be, if you weren't always interrupting me.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/th: Those old-timers are so loud, I can hear them from out here.
When I asked why, he just gave me a thumb's up.
Olric gave me a rock yesterday. Said I "deserved" it.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/tr: I figured the rain would keep you inside all day but I guess you just have to track water all over my showroom...
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/we: Go bother someone else. I'm busy.
Oh, it's you. If you need help with your new garden...
I know you just arrived, but I wouldn't get too comfortable.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/wi: You shouldn't hang around in the cold too long.
If the fire isn't hot enough, the metal can turn out weak.
I have to be a little more mindful of the forge in winter.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/wo: The work never ends. Not that I mind.
Conversations/Bank/March/Banked Lines/yo: You've got a lot to prove, [Ari]. Try not to let everyone down.
Conversations/Bank/March/Gift Lines/gift: A birthday gift? Did Olric put you up to this?
Why did you think I'd want this? Why would anyone want this?
Where'd you find something like this? A =Dragon-Forged Bracelet=... wow. I don't know what to say.
A =Gold Ingot=? Now this is something I can actually use.
I can tell you put some thought into this. Thanks.
What? Are you giving this to me?
Huh, thanks [Ari]. I could turn this into something pretty nice.
Huh. I guess your taste isn't all bad.
Why are you giving me something so thoughtful? Are you expecting something in return?
But thanks, [Ari]. This is really nice.
I guess I'm the only person in town who'd properly appreciate a perfect ore...
Is this an entire ingot of pure mistril? Wow!
=Red Snapper Sushi=? And so artfully prepared...
What exactly are you trying to say here?
Conversations/Bank/March/Market Lines/ma: My signature drink? =Hot Chocolate=, extra marshmallows. ... what?
Olric likes putting butter in his coffee, but I think chocolate just works better.
The sophisticated blend of chocolates that Darcy uses in her =Hot Chocolate= isn't something everyone can appreciate, [Ari].
Maybe it's because I work a forge all day, but I like hot drinks year round, even at the height of summer.
Louis is skilled with all kinds of materials. I wonder if he'd be up for a collaboration...
Louis does repairs, too... he always patches my work apron when it gets singed.
Louis understands that I need clothes that are durable. He's reliable that way.
I admire Louis... he's been through a lot, but it hasn't dimmed his passion.
Ryis was saying my room is too plain and I should get some furniture from Merri... it's like he doesn't get what an honor it is to even see my room!
Refurbishing furniture is interesting, isn't it? With metal, if something isn't working out, I can melt it down and start again...
If you like something, don't dither about it. Merri's stock sells out quick.
Olric really gets along with Merri... he always helps her set up.
Stillwell's the best. I mean, I already know I'm gonna be a huge success, but it's nice to hear the details.
"A great love awaits, if you can lower your defenses." THAT'S my love fortune? Is Stillwell calling me defensive?
Now [Ari], I'm not saying I got a love fortune from Stillwell... but if someone did... and Stillwell told them "love today will be like sparks in a forge"...
... that would be good, right? Because sparks are awesome?
Don't try to bribe Stillwell into giving you a better fortune, it won't change anything.
I trust Vera to dye my hair... she knows red's my color.
Vera is skilled with her craft. I respect that.
Going to have Vera do something about your hair?
I guess I'll have Vera touch them up.
Ugh, Olric said my roots are showing...
Just watch, [Ari]... I'm going to show all these losers how it's done.
Out of the way, [Ari]... I'm going to get Wheedle's prizes before you hog them all for yourself.
I won... a trout. Why was Wheedle keeping a trout in his treasure chest? How did he keep the water in there?
I spent a hundred tesserae to get... one ear of corn? No, you can't have it.
Conversations/Bank/March/Museum Lines/ca: The silver filigree is nice, but eh... I could do better.
Errol asked me to take a look at that $Caldosian Breastplate$ you brought in, [Ari].
Conversations/Bank/March/Museum Lines/lo: The metal knotwork has always been a benchmark to aspire to, and it's even more breathtaking in person.
The $Lost Crown of Aldaria$ is a legend among smiths the world over.
Conversations/Bank/March/Museum Lines/ma: Still... couldn't hurt to drop in on the Magma Beetle at the museum every now and again.
Amongst more superstitious smiths, seeing a $Magma Beetle$ is considered good luck. I guess some people need it.
Conversations/Bank/March/Museum Lines/me: What I wouldn't give to melt it down and make it into something.
Eiland and Errol would run me out of town, but it might be worth it.
There's a real =Meteorite= at the museum.
Conversations/Bank/March/Museum Lines/pe: I'm a little torn about that =Perfect Copper Ore= in the museum. Nice that people can appreciate it, but a chunk that size would make a handsome set of bracelets.
That =Perfect Iron Ore= at the museum is pretty nice. Who donated it, anyway?
I saw that =Perfect Silver Ore= on display at the museum. Nice find.
Conversations/Bank/March/Museum Lines/wo: This town's gone crazy since you arrived.
Let me get this straight, [Ari]. You gave a $Worm$ to the museum? And Errol took it? And now it's on display?
